abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade Policy Loan Project will
            support the first phase of reforms in the Government's
            program to improve domestic efficiency and international
            competitiveness. It has a policy reform component and a
            technical assistance component. The policy reform component
            will be quick disbursing in two tranches. The technical
            assistance component will finance consultants services,
            computer software, and limited computer hardware to support
            key studies and institutional reforms. Trade policy reform
            seeks to encourage production of tradable goods through
            neutralizing productive incentives. The first phase of the
            program will concentrate on the manufacturing sector,
            eliminating quantitative import restrictions, reforming the
            tariff structure, and rationalizing export incentives. In
            the second phase, agricultural import restrictions will be
            eliminated and tariffs further reduced.
